title: Drawing, "Design for Printed Textile-"Eden," Series #1780", 1966
signed: In graphite upper right below inscription: designed by alexander girard 1/6/66
inscribed: In graphite upper right: herman miller fabric pattern / "eden" series no. 1780; Verso: In graphite lower right corner along edge, "HM / FABRIC"
provenance: This collection was donated to the Cooper-Hewitt, National Design Museum in 1969 by Alexander Girard
description: Linear pattern of flowers, leaves, fruit and a bird and snake arranged in squares. Annotated with markings for horizontal and vertical repeats, instructions for over prints, dimensions and colors.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Design for Printed Textile-"Eden," Series #1780", 1966.Graphite on white tracing paper. Gift of Alexander H. Girard. 1969-165-406.
